events.message: The customer reported their vehicle was involved in a collision last night with another car at an intersection.
The claim has been categorized as an auto accident based on the keywords and incident descriptions provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and contact the customer to gather further details.
The customer was informed that their claim has been received and is now under review by the insurance company.
The insurer requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report to support their claim.
The customer uploaded all requested documents, including multiple images of the vehicle damage and the official police report.
Insurance adjusters began to investigate the claim by reviewing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties for additional statements.
The investigation concluded with determination of responsibility and assessment of repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
A settlement offer covering the estimated repair bills was communicated to the customer for review and acceptance.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the responsiveness of the claims process.
The insurance company officially approved the claim following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
Payment to cover the approved claim amount was processed and sent to the customerâ€™s designated bank account.
The claim file was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment by the customer and resolution of the auto accident case.
